about.name: Nive Venkat
about.tagline: Structural Engineer ‚Üí NYU Stern MBA (Business Analytics, Strategy, Technology Product Management)
about.bio:
---
Hi! I‚Äôm **Nive** ‚Äî engineer, AI builder, MBA candidate, and mom ‚Äî and I‚Äôm happy you‚Äôre here. I started my career as a Structural Engineer, designing and managing water infrastructure systems that quietly keep entire cities running. What drew me to engineering back then is still true today: I love breaking down complexity, making sense of data, and building systems that work in the real world.
In 2023, I began my MBA at **NYU Stern**, specializing in Business Analytics, Strategy, and Technology Product Management. That‚Äôs where my curiosity for AI really took off. I became fascinated by how engineering logic, product thinking, and data-driven decision-making come together to create smarter, more resilient organizations.
Since then, I‚Äôve worked on projects ranging from AI-powered product design and climate-tech pricing models to construction-tech strategy and machine learning workflows. Across every space, one thing stays the same: I love turning ambiguity into structure, and structure into solutions people actually use.
Motherhood has added an unexpected and meaningful layer to my journey. Balancing a full-time career, graduate school, and raising a tiny human taught me resilience, empathy, and the power of small, consistent progress. It changed how I lead, how I build, and what I value in the work I choose to do.
Outside of work, you‚Äôll find me baking something sweet, hiking with my family, or inventing new toddler activities for my son. You‚Äôll also find me experimenting with AI tools and side projects ‚Äî anything that blends curiosity with creativity and makes everyday life a little smarter or more joyful.
---
### _**The Real Summary**_
_I design water systems by day, build AI tools by night, and chase a toddler in between._
_If there‚Äôs a messy business problem, I‚Äôll break it down._
_If there‚Äôs data, I‚Äôll analyze it._
_And if there‚Äôs an opportunity to use AI to make life easier, I‚Äôm already building it._
---
I also love connecting with people on similar paths. I regularly mentor students exploring engineering, product, AI, studying abroad, or making early-career decisions. I enjoy helping early-stage startups think through ideas, and I support NGOs and mission-driven teams whenever I can.
If you‚Äôd like to chat, brainstorm, or explore mentorship, feel free to book a time ‚Äî I‚Äôm usually available on weekends:
üëâ **[Book a meeting with me](https://calendar.app.google/F2uy288Db6Jw7Mft8)**
I‚Äôm excited for what comes next and grateful that our paths crossed here.
---

projects.title: Email Summarizer (n8n)
projects.subtitle: Automated weekly digest of top emails with AI
projects.overview: A fully automated email summarizer built using n8n that reads the top 50 emails from a user‚Äôs inbox, categorizes key themes, extracts to-do items, and delivers a weekly summary email with highlights and actionable next steps. It connects with Gmail, uses OpenAI for intelligent summarization, and compiles the output into a clean, readable digest sent every Monday.
stack: OpenAI API for summarization and extraction
target_users: Busy professionals drowning in email clutter
Consultants and managers managing multiple clients
Students and researchers seeking weekly knowledge digests
Knowledge workers balancing communication and analysis
impact: Reduces inbox review time by up to 70%
Improves focus by surfacing only what matters

projects.title: FEMA Companion
projects.subtitle: AI knowledge assistant for seismic design (RAG)
projects.overview:
### *Overview* A Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) tool that makes **FEMA P-750** and **NIST GCR 2016** seismic design guidelines fully searchable. The system enables engineers to ask natural-language questions and receive precise, citation-backed answers. --- ### **Problem** Seismic codes are dense, technical, and difficult to navigate. Engineers spend significant time manually searching hundreds of pages, often missing important clauses. No existing solution provides fast, authoritative, clause-level lookup grounded directly in source documents. --- ### **Architecture Diagram (High-Level RAG Pipeline)** ```mermaid flowchart LR A[User] --> B[Query Handler] B --> C[Vector Search] C --> D["Document Chunks
(FEMA / NIST)"] D --> E[Embeddings] E --> F[LLM Reasoning] F --> G["Final Answer
+ Citations"] ``` --- ### **Tech Stack** - LangChain - ChromaDB - OpenAI embeddings - GPT models - Python / Streamlit - PDF parsing with `pypdf` --- ### **Key Challenges** - Designing chunk sizes for technical engineering text - Preventing LLM hallucinations with strict grounding constraints - Ensuring consistent citation mapping - Handling mixed-format engineering documents --- ### **What I Learned** - How to build a complete RAG system end-to-end - How retrieval quality affects answer accuracy and trustworthiness - How to design usable AI tools for domain experts - How to enforce accuracy and grounding in engineering workflows ---

projects.title: SalesSense AI
projects.subtitle: Real-time sales intelligence agent (RAG + automation)
projects.overview: An AI-powered Sales Intelligence Agent that transforms raw sales data and reports into conversational insights. An n8n automation monitors a Drive/CRM export folder for new files, ingests and embeds them into a vector database, and enables users to ask questions like ‚ÄúHow close are we to this month‚Äôs goal?‚Äù. Produces cited, KPI-grounded responses and scheduled ‚ÄúSales Snapshot‚Äù emails.
stack: n8n automation layer for file change detection
Data normalization for CSVs, Sheets, PDFs
GPT query engine with cited, KPI-focused answers
target_users: Sales and business managers tracking monthly goals
Strategy teams aligning OKRs with metrics
impact: Reduces manual report compilation time by ~80%
Delivers live insights grounded in company data

resume.summary: Engineer-turned-MBA specializing in business analytics, strategy, and AI-enabled product development. Blends systems thinking from structural engineering with data-driven decision-making and product execution. Open to roles in product management, strategy/ops, and applied AI.
experience: Structural Engineer ‚Äî Designed and managed water infrastructure projects with cross-functional coordination and rigorous calculation/QA workflows.
Graduate Projects ‚Äî Led/assisted AI-driven product design, carbon credit pricing models, and digital transformation (sustainability focus).
education: MBA, NYU Stern ‚Äî Business Analytics, Strategy, Tech Product Management (2023‚Äìpresent)
